problem_summary_simple: Compress a character array by replacing consecutive duplicates with the character and count.
problem_summary_technical: Uses two pointers (anchor and write) to modify the array in-place, handling counts greater than 9.
key_insights: The problem requires in-place modification with constant extra space.
Two pointers are used: `read` to iterate through the original array and `write` to place the compressed characters.
When a group of repeating characters ends, the character is written, followed by its count (converted to characters if > 9).
